TenUI::TenUI

TenUI::TenUI Class Reference

#include <TenUI.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Singleton class that manages TenUI Input, Graphics, UIComponents, and Application

Singleton Implementation Methods

Methods for adding, removing, and querying UIComponents.

static TenUI* TenUI::TenUI::createInstance ( ITenUIApp *   )  throw (int) [static]

Creates a new instance of TenUI given a ITenUIApp. Should only be used by the IMPLEMENT_TENUI_APP macros

Returns a pointer to the TenUI object.

Returns a pointer to the IGraphics.

Adds a UIComponent at the root level.

void TenUI::TenUI::removeUIComponent ( DisplayObjectIDType  uicompid  )  [inline]

Removes UIComponent from TenUI. Doesn't have to be at the root level.

Parameters:
uicompid DisplayObject ID of the UIComponent.

shared_ptr<UIComponent> TenUI::TenUI::getUIComponent ( DisplayObjectIDType  uicompid  ) 

Gets a pointer to a UIComponent given a DisplayObject ID

Parameters:
uicompid Display Object ID of the UIComponent.

shared_ptr<UIComponent> TenUI::TenUI::getUIComponentsAt ( int  x,
int  y 
)

Gets a pointer to the top-most UIComponent at a given screen coordinate. "top-most" describes a UIComponent that rendered later then others, and thus rendered ontop of possibly overlapping UIComponents.

Parameters:
x X screen cordinate
y Y screen coordinate

void TenUI::TenUI::run (  ) 

Kicks off execution of the registered TenUI application This is a blocking call.

void TenUI::TenUI::quit (  ) 

Requests a halt of execution. Execution will stop the next cycle that processes a quit has been requested. TenUI Applications should call this method to exit.
